passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • The Office is a popular American television sitcom that aired from 2005 to 2013. • The show was adapted from the British version created by Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant. • The Office is set in the Scranton, Pennsylvania, branch of the fictional Dunder Mifflin Paper Company. • The series employs a documentary-style format, with characters frequently speaking directly to the camera.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to introduce the premise of The Office to someone unfamiliar with the show?

choices.A: The Office is a television sitcom that aired from 2005 to 2013 and was adapted from a British version.
choices.B: The Office, an American sitcom set in the fictional Dunder Mifflin Paper Company, employs a documentary-style format with characters speaking directly to the camera.
choices.C: Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant created the original British version of The Office, which was later adapted into an American show.
choices.D: The Office takes place in the Scranton, Pennsylvania, branch of the fictional Dunder Mifflin Paper Company and was adapted from a British show.

explanation: B: 'The Office, an American sitcom set in the fictional Dunder Mifflin Paper Company, employs a documentary-style format with characters speaking directly to the camera.' is the correct answer because it introduces the premise of The Office and its unique format to someone unfamiliar with the show.
distractor_explanation: 'The Office is a television sitcom that aired from 2005 to 2013 and was adapted from a British version.' is incorrect because it only provides information about the show's duration and adaptation but does not introduce the premise.

'Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant created the original British version of The Office, which was later adapted into an American show.' is incorrect because it focuses on the creators and adaptation without introducing the premise.

'The Office takes place in the Scranton, Pennsylvania, branch of the fictional Dunder Mifflin Paper Company and was adapted from a British show.' is incorrect because it only provides information about the setting and adaptation, but does not mention the documentary-style format.
